Sequential.LossFunctions

Interface LossFunction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CrossEntropy, MeanSquaredError

    public interface LossFunction

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double calculateLoss(double[] expected, double[] actual)
      Get the loss resulting from a single foward pass through the network.
      double[] calculatePDerivatives(double[] expected, double[] actual)
      Get the partial of the loss with respect to each of the outputs of the network.
      void writeFunc(java.io.FileWriter fWrite)
      Serialize the loss function to the file pointed to by the given FileWriter.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateLoss

        double calculateLoss(double[] expected,
                     double[] actual)
              throws InvalidDimensionException
        Get the loss resulting from a single foward pass through the network.
        Parameters:
        expected - Array of expected outputs.
        actual - Array of actual outputs.
        Returns:
        The quantity of loss between the expected and actual outputs.
        Throws:
        InvalidDimensionException

      • calculatePDerivatives

        double[] calculatePDerivatives(double[] expected,
                               double[] actual)
                        throws InvalidDimensionException
        Get the partial of the loss with respect to each of the outputs of the network.
        Parameters:
        expected - Array of expected outputs.
        actual - Array of actual outputs.
        Returns:
        Array of partial derivatives representing the change in loss with respect to that element.
        Throws:
        InvalidDimensionException

      • writeFunc

        void writeFunc(java.io.FileWriter fWrite)
        throws java.io.IOException
        Serialize the loss function to the file pointed to by the given FileWriter.
        Parameters:
        fWrite - FileWriter object that should be written to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
